Name: Block_Quotes
Greenwich Village: ['The streets of Greenwich Village offer you the quaint feel of a small European city while still being minutes from everything New York has to offer.', "If you're looking for close proximity to Soho, Nolita, MeatPack, TriBeca and the Village...it doesn't get any better"]

Name: Lede
Greenwich Village: Greenwich Villages ultra-convenient location is outshined by the eclectic mix of creative college students, purpose-driven professionals, and inquisitive visitors that frequent its cozy, tree-lined streets. This neighborhood manages to feel intimate while maintaining a metropolitan edge. Grocers and bakers know your name in Greenwich Village, but should you want to remain anonymous you dont have to go far to get lost in the crowds of the big city.

Name: Photo_Headers
Greenwich Village: ['A Village Inside the City', "Greenwich Village's Student Scene"]

Name: Intro
Greenwich Village: Greenwich Village possesses an intimate appeal in the midst of a metropolitan atmosphere.

Name: Photo_Captions
Greenwich Village: ['In Greenwich Village, you can enjoy life slowly in the midst of a fast-paced city.', 'Sidewalk cafes and flower boxes make every corner in Greenwich Village a little more cozy.', 'Despite its popularity, Greenwich Village maintains an intimate appeal. Macdougal Street, a favorite among Village locals, boasts petite shops and specialty stores.', "Stop by often enough, and it's likely the baker will get to know your name.", "Places to sip and spaces to study prevail in Greenwich Village, a student-centric neighborhood whose savvy shops match its populace's discerning attitude.", 'Students continue to frequent The Stonewall Inn, a Greenwich Village landmark that has championed gay rights since 1969.', 'As the geographic focal point of Greenwich Village, Washington Square Park brings together a lively mix of NYU students, filmers, dreamers, chess-players, and protesters.', 'End scene.']
